alert.note: Alert for Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Brevard County through 645 PM EDT... At 559 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Viera to near Camp Holly Fish Camp. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Rockledge, Cocoa and Cocoa Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
